channel.title: Samsung YP-Z5 [UPDATE]
channel.description:
Okay, 2 day project and I think I'm happy with it. After taking a tutorial on doing some proper studio rendering, and doing some tweaking, I think it's near to perfect.
So, what do you think? Modelled in 3ds Max, rendered in Vray.
Based on: [img]http://tech2.in.com/media/images/uploads/2006/05/samsung-yp-z5-black-2gb.jpg[/img]
Tinted clay render: [url=http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Samsungmp397.png]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Samsungmp397.png[/url]
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Samsungmp395.png[/img]
[img]http://i285.photobucket.com/albums/ll63/Silent_CJ/Samsungmp396.png[/img]

Ahaa, don’t worry, I looked through 60 pages of the graphics section and checked every single topic of yours to see how you’ve progressed over the years/months. (stalker much, ikr )

uhhhh i did the same thing to archer and sth. You’re making your way through this alot like i did…
[/quote]

Haha, well I hope I end up as good as you one day, still can’t do guns. ;([/quote]
the farther you go the more easy understanding complex shapes becomes.

item.title: Samsung YP-Z5 [UPDATE]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:27, topic:347189”]Well I’ve been doing it since like middle school, but back then it really wasn’t too often or anything serious, just editing already made models and learning.

And yes, I am.[/quote]

Oh that’s good then.
There’s a place just in my town, 5 minutes walk which does a lot of architectural design and CGI, and they use 3ds max and vray, so the work I’m doing right now is ideal for training, and they offered me a job last summer but I didn’t think my skills were good enough yet.
Here’s their site if you wanna peek, it’s pretty darn good.
http://www.tigerx.co.uk/

[quote=“Frell, post:28, topic:347189”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=443564.msg3271058#msg3271058 date=1279207246]But now I do it at least 9 hours a day.
[/quote]
ahh yes… the good ol all nighters to finish a model to get started on a new one.

I started with http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,123606.msg1217638.html#msg1217638
and went to http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,250643.0.html

lol[/quote]

Ahaa, don’t worry, I looked through 60 pages of the graphics section and checked every single topic of yours to see how you’ve progressed over the years/months. (stalker much, ikr )

Read full topic

item.title: Samsung YP-Z5 [UPDATE]
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yes but I can’t remember ever doing a phone or MP3 player (besides iPod, but that was like 3 minutes of work).

I can’t even remember when I started. It’s been at least 7 years though. I started when I was young.
But I’d only model in my free time, or I would go periods of time without modeling. But now I do it at least 9 hours a day.

Read full topic

item.title: Samsung YP-Z5 [UPDATE]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

SomethingToHide:

I’ve been at this for years. And I haven’t done a guitar in a while. So you’re off to a nice start.

This is the mp3 topic not the guitar topic.
But yeaah, I know, I started in september 2008 low poly modelling on a japanese freeware program, been doing this genre of work for a while, but only recently moved on to the more complex programs.

Read full topic

item.title: Samsung YP-Z5 [UPDATE]
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:18, topic:347189”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=443564.msg3258811#msg3258811 date=1278341026]
Proved my point.

See the edges around the chrome casing? They aren’t sharp at all. They actually look very round.

You could do what you said. Select the edge loop, bevel it (since the real edge is more round you should use a 1 roundness value and 2-3 segments).

And by tesselation I mean I can count the polygons around the edges. Look at the corners of the chrome rim and phone casing. (Nevermind, it doesn’t show in the new pictures.
[/quote]

Ah yes.
I think by this I’ve learnt a lesson, nothing in the world (except maybe a knife blade) is perfectly perpendicular or sharp, there’s always a curve, big or small.

And oh, that’s just cause I forgot to use smoothing, I don’t think anything is smoothed at all. :/[/quote]

Pretty much. If you have >70 degree angles it probably isn’t looking right.

Read full topic

item.title: Samsung YP-Z5 [UPDATE]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

SomethingToHide:

I can see the tesselation, so that’s not good. Doesn’t look comfortable to hold. The silver outside rim is the problem. It’s way too sharp.

Well aren’t you picky.
Nah, thanks for criticism.

By the tessellation being visible, where are you referring to exactly?

And well, try telling the designers at Samsung that, I must admit, mine isn’t that comfortable, but the one shown above looks exactly like mine.
Unless, I could chamfer the edges of the chrome casing or whatever it is by a value of about ‘0.02’, maybe that’d give it a less incredibly sharp look.

Read full topic
